\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Node to perform the motion of the robotic arm. 

\begin{DoxyVersion}{Version}
1.\+0 
\end{DoxyVersion}
\begin{DoxyAuthor}{Author}
Alessio Roda 
\end{DoxyAuthor}
\begin{DoxyDate}{Date}
September 2022
\end{DoxyDate}
description\+: It\textquotesingle{}s a simple node in which the robot arm moves in five different positions already defined with the moveit\+\_\+setup\+\_\+assistant. 

\doxysubsection{Function Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{movearm_8cpp_a3c04138a5bfe5d72780bb7e82a18e627}\label{movearm_8cpp_a3c04138a5bfe5d72780bb7e82a18e627}} 
\index{movearm.cpp@{movearm.cpp}!main@{main}}
\index{main@{main}!movearm.cpp@{movearm.cpp}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{main()}{main()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily int main (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{argc,  }\item[{char $\ast$$\ast$}]{argv }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Main function of the node. 

int main(argc, argv)


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em argc} & the number of argument passed as parameters\\
\hline
{\em argv} & the vector of string containing each argument\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
0 when the program ends
\end{DoxyReturn}
description\+: The main function, makes all the initializations as follows\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Initializess the node
\item Loads the arm model of the robot described with the moveit\+\_\+setup\+\_\+assistant
\item Get the \char`\"{}arm\char`\"{} move group to move the robotic arm
\item Moves the arm in an infinite loop in five different poses, such that the robot can explore the environment with the camera, It starts from the default position, than it rotates around 360 degrees and folds in order to see better the markers that are on the floor 
\end{DoxyItemize}
